sen.j: なお、韓国併合条約及び関連する詔書により、「韓国皇帝陛下太皇帝陛下皇太子殿下並其ノ后妃及後裔」に該当する者を王族とし、李王家の当主も王というが、皇族の王と王族の王は全く違うものである。
sen.e: According to the treaty of the annexation of Korea, 'emperor of Korea, his Majesty, emperor, crown prince and princess and descendents' were called the royal family, the head of the Lee royal family was called a king, but the king of the imperial family was different from the king of the royal family.

According to the Japan-Korea Annexation Treaty and the related imperial edict, 'His Majesty the Emperor of Korea, His Majesty the Retired Emperor, His Majesty the Crown Prince and their empresses and descendents' were called the royal family, and the head of the Lee royal family was also called a king, but the king of the imperial family was different from the king of the royal family.
sen.cmt: 「李王家の当主も」というニュアンスを出しました。「関連する詔書」の訳を補いました。王族の称号を修正しました。「太皇帝」の定訳不明。日韓併合条約は"Japan-Korea Annexation Treaty"が定訳と思われます。

sen.j: なお、幕末以後日本が西洋と国交を開いた直後には、西洋の皇帝（＝天皇）と王の関係を日本や中国と同様の非対等な関係と誤解をして、帝制の国家と王制の国家あての国書に格差を付けてしまった為に、紛糾したと言われている。
sen.e: Soon after Japan established diplomatic relations with the West at the end of Edo Period, the Japanese government misunderstood that the relationship between the emperor (Japanese emperor) and king of the West was an unequal relationship like that in Japan and Chine, and discriminated sovereign's messages to imperial states from those to royal states, causing confusions.
